intro: Gagea foliosa subsp. ellyptica, commonly known as the elliptic leaf gagea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has a fibrous root system. Its botanical features include a corm-like structure and a short stem with clustered inflorescences. It is often found in montane and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
